unit.name: Bretonnian Lord
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Heavy armour. Special Rules: Knightly Vow.

unit.name: Prophetess of the Lady
unit.description: Magic: The Prophetess is a Level 4 wizard. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: MR (1).

unit.name: Battle Standard
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Heavy armour. Special Rules: Knightly Vow, Battle Standard.

unit.name: Damsel of the Lady
unit.description: Magic: A Damsel is a Level 2 wizard. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: none.

unit.name: Paladin
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Heavy armour. Special Rules: Knightly Vow.

unit.name: Knights of the Realm
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Lance, heavy armour and shield. Special Rules: Heavy Cavalry, Lance Formation, Knightly Vow.

unit.name: Knight Errant
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Lance, Light armour and shield. Special Rules: Lance Formation, Knightly Vow, Impetuous.

unit.name: Men-At-Arms
unit.description: Equipment: Pole-arm, light armour and shield. Special Rules: Peasants Duty, Anti-Cav (spear).

unit.name: Peasant Bowmen
unit.description: Equipment: Longbow. Special Rules: Peasants Duty, Defensive Stakes, Volley Fire.

unit.name: Peasant Huntsmen
unit.description: Equipment: Longbow. Special Rules: Peasants Duty, Skirmish, Scouts.

unit.name: Questing Knight
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Great weapon and heavy armour. Special Rules: Lance Formation, Questing Vow.

unit.name: Knights Templar
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Lance, heavy armour and shield. Special Rules: Heavy Cavalry, Lance Formation, Questing Vow.

unit.name: Pegasus Knight
unit.description: Mount: Pegasus. Equipment: Lance, heavy armour and shield. Special Rules: Flying Unit, March Blocker, Knightly Vow.

unit.name: Mounted Yeoman
unit.description: Mount: Warhorse. Equipment: Spear, bow and light armour (or shield). Special Rules: Peasants Duty, Light Cavalry.

unit.name: Grail Reliquae
unit.description: Equipment: Light armour and Shield. Special Rules: Peasants Duty, Stubborn, Hatred, Ward Save (6+), MR (1), Grail Reliquae.

unit.name: Castle Guard
unit.description: Equipment: Heavy armour and shield. Special Rules: Block (shield), Bodyguard, Knightly Vow.

unit.name: Grail Knight
unit.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse. Equipment: Lance, heavy armour and shield. Special Rules: Heavy Cavalry, Lance Formation, Living Saints, Grail Vow.

unit.name: Field Trebuchet
unit.description: Warmachine: 4 Peasants. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Peasants Duty, Field Trebuchet.

mount.name: Royal Pegasus
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Flying Model, March Blocker.

mount.name: Pegasus
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Flying Model, March Blocker.

mount.name: Hippogryph
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Flying Model, Large Target, Terror.

mount.name: Bretonnian Unicorn
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon Special Rules: Daemonic Ward Save (5+), Magical Attacks, MR (2), Impale (1).

item.name: Antlers of the Great Hunt
item.description: When the bearer and his unit pursue roll an additional dice and discard the lowest.

item.name: Armour of Midsummer Sun
item.description: Heavy armour, models that attack the bearer or its mount in cc or with a shooting attack suffer -1 to their to-hit rolls. Only attacks directed at the model itself are affected, i.e. if the model joined a unit, shooting at the unit does not suffer -1 to hit.

item.name: BM Portent of Far (5+)
item.description: Augment, Range 18", target unit rerolls natural 1s for to-hit and to-wound rolls until the casters next magic phase.

item.name: BM Resurrection (9+)
item.description: Augment, Range 18", target unit gets D3 infantry models (US1) or 1 cavalry model (US2) back. Spell only works on unit type infantry and cavalry. Has no effect on character models. Units can only get models back up to the unit size they started the game with. Resurrected command group models return as common models of their unit.

item.name: BM Strangle Root Curse (8+)
item.description: Hex, Range 24", target unit suffers -1M, -1WS, -1BS and -1I until the casters next magic phase.

item.name: BM The Beast Cowers (9+)
item.description: Hex, Range 24". Target unit halves its M (including mounts). Flyers have to use their ground movement but do not half their M. Target unit cannot declare a charge or charge even if it would be forced to (e.g. because of Frenzy). Units with Random Movement stop 1" in front of enemy units. Further, the target unit suffers -1 to to-hit rolls in cc. Lasts until the casters next magic phase. The spell has no effect on Infantry (Type Inf).

item.name: BM The Crows Feast (7+)
item.description: MM, Range 24", 2D6 S3 hits

item.name: BM Uranons Thunder Bolt (8+)
item.description: MM, Range 24", D6 S4 hits, noAS

item.name: Banner of Chalon
item.description: Enemy may not Stand and Shoot at this unit.

item.name: Banner of Defence
item.description: If the unit has the Blessing then it gains a Ward Save (4+) versus ranged attacks (i.e. shooting and magic missiles) with S6+. This includes characters within the unit as long as they have the Blessing as well.

item.name: Banner of the Lady
item.description: All units in btb with the bearer get no rank bonuses in cc. This includes friendly units.

item.name: Birth-Sword of Carcassone
item.description: +1S, Enemy has to reroll successful armour saves.

item.name: Blessing of the Lady
item.description: After deployment the bretonnian army may pray to gain the Blessing of the Lady. If the army prays it gains the Blessing but the opponent may decide if he wants to go first or second, i.e. there is no roll for first turn. If both players play Bretonnia and both decide to pray, roll for first turn as usual. The Blessing affects all character models and units with a Vow (see below) which get a Ward Save (6+) and a Ward Save (5+) versus hits with S6 or more. Mounts do NOT benefit from this save. A character model or unit loses the Blessing if - it flees for any reason (incl. breaking from combat) - it refuses a challenge. If multiple units and characters are part of the same combat then each individual part loses the blessing.

item.name: Braid of Bordeleaux
item.description: Use at the start of your turn. Until the end of turn the model gains +1Ld and the character and his unit treat any water terrain (swamp, river, pond etc.) as open terrain. One use only.

item.name: Braziers
item.description: If the unit did not move, the unit rerolls natural 1s for to-wound rolls when attacking with longbows.

item.name: Chalice of Malfleur
item.description: At the start of each enemy players magic phase the bearer may roll a D6: on a roll of a 1 the bearer suffers one wound with no saves of any kind allowed. On a roll of 2+ the army gets +1 DD for this magic phase.

item.name: Conquerors Tapestry
item.description: Before the game starts you must unveil this standard to your opponent. Every standard captured by this unit counts as two captured standards for the purpose of VP calculation. Should this standard be captured by your opponent it also counts as two captured standards for the purpose of VP calculation.

item.name: Cuirass of Fortune
item.description: Heavy armour, bearer rerolls to-wound rolls of natural 1s

item.name: Defensive Stakes
item.description: Units that charge this unit to its front lose all charge bonuses. If the unit moves, the stakes are destroyed (and this special rule is lost).

item.name: Dispel Scroll
item.description: Automatically dispels one spell without the need of DD. One use only.

item.name: Dragons Claw
item.description: Ward Save (5+)

item.name: Enchanted Shield
item.description: Shield that grants +2 AS

item.name: Errantry Banner
item.description: Knights Errant receives +1S on the charge but suffer - 2 to their Impetuous tests. Has no effect on mounts.

item.name: Falcon Horn of Fredemund
item.description: Activate at the start of any turn. Flying models using their fly movement move at half speed until the end of turn. One use only.

item.name: Field Trebuchet
item.description: Catapult, Range 12"-60", 3" Template, S5(10), no AS, D3 wounds.

item.name: Fleur de Lys
item.description: MR (1)

item.name: Gauntlet of the Duel
item.description: Enemy cannot refuse a challenge issued by the bearer.

item.name: Grail Reliquae
item.description: - Counts as both a standard and musician. The standard is NOT lost when the unit breaks from combat but counts as captured should the unit be whipped out completely in close combat. - Every time the Grail Reliquae would suffer wounds remove one Battle Pilgrim per wound instead, i.e. it is only possible to kill the Grail Reliquae when there are no Battle Pilgrims left in the unit. - The model of the Grail Reliquae is always placed in the centre of the first rank. The unit counts their rank bonus as if the space the Grail Reliquae takes up was filled with Battle Pilgrims

item.name: Grail Vow
item.description: Models with the Grail Vow are Immune to Psychology and all their attacks count as magical.

item.name: Gromril Great Helm
item.description: +1 AS and immunity to the effects of Killing Blow

item.name: Guilded Cuirass
item.description: Ward Save (4+)

item.name: Heartwood Lance
item.description: Lance, reroll failed to-wound rolls

item.name: Holy Icon
item.description: MR (2)

item.name: Icon of Quenelles
item.description: Use at any time. The bearer and her unit gain or regain the Blessing. One use only.

item.name: Impetuous
item.description: - At the end of the declare charges phase, if the unit didnt declare a charge but would be able to (has an enemy unit within charge range and could legally charge), it has to pass a Ld-test or has to charge the nearest possible enemy unit. - When the unit charges it gains the Immune to Psychology special rule until the end of turn. This includes character models that are with the unit.

item.name: Insignia of the Quest
item.description: When the model is reduced to one wound it gains a Ward Save (3+). Should the model be killed by an attack that causes multiple wounds without being reduced to a single wound, roll a D6: on a roll of 3+ the model is not killed and survives with one wound.

item.name: Knightly Vow
item.description: Models with the Knightly Vow and their units are immune to panic from units with the Peasants Duty special rule.

item.name: Lance Formation
item.description: Whenever this unit ranks up 3 models wide it benefits from the following special rules: - Character models must be placed in the front rank, displacing the standard bearer and musician to the second rank if necessary. The unit still benefits from its standard and musician even when they are not in the first rank. - In each rank models are positioned at the flanks first then the middle position is filled. - In cc the unit gains a +1 rank bonus for a full (3 models) 3rd and 4th rank respectively (i.e. max. +2). - Models at the flank in the 2nd and 3rd rank of the unit that are not in btb may attack as if they were in btb like the model in the first rank in their respective file. - Up to one Damsel or Prophetess may be placed in the middle of the 2nd rank as long as there are at least 3 other models left that form the front rank. The model may use magic and has LOS like the model directly in front of it (e.g. to cast spells) but can also be seen by the opponent and thus may be targeted with attacks with the Sniper special rule for example. Even though LOS is determined by the model in the centre of the first rank, all distances are measured from (and to) the model itself. In addition the unit may still benefit from the Ld of the model and if it is the general, it may make use of its Inspiring Presence special rule.

item.name: Lance of Artois
item.description: Lance with Killing Blow

item.name: Light armour (loses light Cavalry rule)
item.description: 6+AS

item.name: Living Saints
item.description: - All Grail Knights can issue, accept and refuse challenges. - Grail Knights benefit from the Ladys Blessing even when the army did not pray. But they can still lose the Blessing as usual.

item.name: Mane of the Purebred
item.description: The Warhorses of the bearer and his unit get +1S until the end of turn during their first successful charge (i.e. there is a combat) in the game.

item.name: Mantle of Damsel Elena
item.description: Ward Save (4+) and immunity to the effects of poison and KB.

item.name: Morningstar of Fracasse
item.description: +2S in the first round of each combat. In addition in each combat phase a model is hit by this weapon it has to roll a D6: on a 1-3 the magic weapon of the model is destroyed.

item.name: PM 2nd Sign of Amul 2/5+
PM 2nd Sign of Amul 3/5+
item.description: The player gets D3 rerolls. Each reroll can be used to reroll one to-hit roll, to-wound roll, armour save or ward save. Any rerolls not used at the end of the players turn are wasted.

item.name: PM Celestial Shield 2/5+
PM Celestial Shield 3/5+
item.description: Augment, Range 18", 5+ Ward Save vs ranged attacks and spells until the casters next magic phase. Has no effect on character models.

item.name: PM Cure 2/7+
PM Cure 3/7+
item.description: Augment, Range 18", target model recovers 1 wound

item.name: Peasants Duty
item.description: This unit may use the Leadership of any non-broken knight within 6".

item.name: Pole-arm
item.description: Can be used as either halberd or spear. Declare at the start of each combat how the unit utilizes the weapon.

item.name: Potion Sacre
item.description: Declare use before rolling dice to dispel or cast a spell (BM or PM). You may modify one dice by +1. Can prevent miscasts and cause irresistible force. One use only.

item.name: Power Stone
item.description: +2PD to cast a spell. Dice used may exceed maximum allowed by level. One use only.

item.name: Purebred
item.description: Bretonnian warhorses do not suffer -1M from barding.

item.name: Questing Vow
item.description: Models with the Questing Vow and their units reroll failed panic tests and are immune to panic from units with the Peasants Duty special rule.

item.name: Sacrament of the Lady
item.description: Immune to effects of first miscast (BM or PM)

item.name: Shield of Agilulf
item.description: Shield that grants WS10

item.name: Shields (loses light Cavalry rule)
item.description: +1AS

item.name: Silver Lance of the Blessed
Silver Lance o. the Blessed
item.description: As long as the bearer benefits from the Blessing it automatically hits with this lance.

item.name: Sirennes Locket
item.description: The bearer can only suffer one wound per turn from non-magical attacks.

item.name: Staff of Sorcery
item.description: +1 to total roll to attempt to dispel a spell.

item.name: Sword of Heroes
item.description: Versus opponents with T5+ the bearer gets +1S and causes D3 wounds

item.name: Sword of the Ladys Champion
Sword of the Ladys Cha.
item.description: The bearer S equals the targets T+1 for all attacks with this weapon (includes armour save modifiers).

item.name: Sword of the Quest
item.description: Can be used as hand weapon or great weapon, in addition attacks with this weapon ignore armour saves.

item.name: The Grail Shield
item.description: Shield, reroll failed armour saves

item.name: The Ruby Goblet
item.description: At the end of the phase during which the bearer and/or his unit lost their first wound, the bearer and his unit (as long as he stays with it) may never be wounded on better than 3+ for the rest of the game. Does not affect magical attacks.

item.name: The Silver Mirror
item.description: If the bearer or the unit she joined is the target of a spell you can decide to try to deflect the spell back to its origin instead of trying to dispel it. To do so, you have to roll a D6: on a roll of 1-2 you fail and the bearer and her unit suffer the effect of the spell. On a roll of 3+ the spell is deflected and hits the caster of the spell if its player is unable to dispel it (may use PD as DD or other abilities e.g. Dispel Scroll). One use only.

item.name: The Verdant Heart
item.description: The bearer and her unit treat woods as open terrain for movement. In addition the bearer gains +1 to cast (BM and PM) when in a wood.

item.name: Token of the Damsel
item.description: Ward Save (2+) versus first wound suffered (after armour save)

item.name: Tress of Isolde
item.description: At the start of any cc phase nominate 1 enemy model. The bearer hits this model on an unmodified 2+ for that phase. One use only.

item.name: Twilight Banner
item.description: If the unit does not charge it can move as if it was ethereal, i.e. it can move through obstacles and over any terrain without penalty. One use only.

item.name: Valorous Standard
item.description: This unit rolls 3D6 for Ld-based tests and picks the 2 lowest dice.

item.name: Virtue of Audacity
item.description: The character rerolls failed to-hit and to-wound rolls against opponents with S5+.

item.name: Virtue of Confidence
item.description: The character must always issue and accept challenges (if possible). It also rerolls failed to-hit and to-wound rolls in challenges.

item.name: Virtue of Discipline
item.description: The character and any friendly units in the same combat do not suffer any negative effects should they be outnumbered in combat, e.g. no +1 combat resolution bonus for the opponent.

item.name: Virtue of Duty
item.description: The character gains +1CR as long as the general is alive. This model cannot be the general.

item.name: Virtue of Empathy
item.description: The character gains a shield for free but loses its mount, i.e. the character has to fight on foot. The character may join units with the Peasants Duty special rule. In addition, all friendly units with the Peasants Duty special rule within 12" may use the Ld of this character (works like Inspiring Presence).

item.name: Virtue of Heroism
item.description: If the character fights with a mundane (i.e. non magical) weapon, it causes D3 wounds versus models with the Large Target special rule.

item.name: Virtue of Knightly Temper
item.description: The character gains +1A.

item.name: Virtue of Noble Disdain
item.description: The character gains Hatred against all models with missile weapons (including warmachine crews). In addition any unit it joins ignores Panic tests from suffering 25+% of casualties from shooting attacks.

item.name: Virtue of Purity
item.description: The character benefits from the Ladys Blessing even when the army did not pray. In addition the Blessing grants this model a Ward Save (5+) against all attacks.

item.name: Virtue of Stoicism
item.description: The character and his unit reroll failed break tests.

item.name: Virtue of the Impetuous Knight
Virtue of the Impetuous K.
item.description: The character and his unit gain +1M.

item.name: Virtue of the Joust
item.description: The character rerolls failed to-hit rolls when fighting with a lance (including magical ones).

item.name: Virtue of the Penitent
item.description: The character gains Stubborn. It cannot take magic items, may never join units and cannot ride monstrous mounts, e.g. a Royal Pegasus or Hippogryph.

item.name: Volley Fire
item.description: If the unit did not move, up to half (rounding up) of the models from the second rank may also fire their ranged weapons in the shooting phase.

item.name: Vows
item.description: - Knightly Vow: Models with the Knightly Vow and their units are immune to panic from units with the Peasants Duty special rule. - Questing Vow: Models with the Questing Vow and their units reroll failed panic tests and are immune to panic from units with the Peasants Duty special rule. - Grail Vow: Models with the Grail Vow are Immune to Psychology and all their attacks count as magical. Characters with a vow cannot join units with no vow or a higher vow than their own (ranking: knightly vow < questing vow < grail vow).

item.name: War Banner
item.description: +1CR

item.name: Wyrmlance
item.description: Lance with Poisoned Attacks (1). In addition the bearer has a breath weapon attack with S4 that can be used once per battle.

item.name: Yeoman Craftsman
item.description: Unit Champion
